linkable_points: Septic tanks naturally separate waste into three layers: scum (floating), effluent (middle liquid), and sludge (settled solids at bottom)
Sludge and scum removal typically costs $400-$800 in Miami-Dade, more than regular pumping due to complete cleaning required
When sludge reaches one-third of tank depth or scum layers become thick, complete removal is needed to prevent system problems
Complete sludge and scum removal differs from regular pumping by thoroughly cleaning all layers and tank interior, restoring full capacity
Removing sludge and scum layers prevents solids from entering drain fields, protecting expensive drain field systems from damage
Miami's high water table and warm climate can accelerate sludge accumulation, making regular removal especially important
Professional sludge removal uses specialized equipment to break up and remove hardened sludge that standard pumping cannot remove
Sludge and scum removal should be done every 3-5 years or when layers become excessive, maintaining optimal tank function

competitors.notes: Most septic contractors offer sludge and scum removal as part of comprehensive cleaning services
